description: Family business is the more common type of firm around the world. This is especially so in Asia, where family firms not just dominate the small firm category but also constitute the majority of companies listed on most Asian stock exchanges. This course provides students the opportunity to develop a deep understanding of family firms across Asia, with a special focus on Southeast Asia. Aside from a better understanding of how to sustain a family firm from the perspective of the family, the course will also take an outsiderâ€™s perspective, including investors, partners, executives, and policy makers.
title: Family Business in Asia
